result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher L Gaspie was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant IS Eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Programs. Sentence credit of 42 days were granted.

superMiscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to costs. Balance to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered. Inform agent of all prescriptions.

Case 15CF1601 was dismissed and read in. Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. Maintain employment and/or school combination. Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by agent. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Christopher L Gaspie in court, in custody, with Attorney Amber K. Rumpf.   Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #1.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1.  Count #2 is dismissed and read-in.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Rumpf makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  IMPOSED SENTENCE OF:   

3 YEARS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - 42 days)
  -  18 MONTHS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  18 MONTHS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed.
____Inform Agent of all prescriptions
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 

COSTS:  $268.00 & $250.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid out of cash bail posted and remainder due as a condition of probation)

CONDITION TIME: 

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program. 

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Hearing at 01-25-2016 10:00 am
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Christopher L Gaspie in court, in custody, with attorney Amber K. Rumpf.   Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Atty. Rumpf moves to modify bail.  State objects.  Court denies the motion.    Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for January 25, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing at 01-06-2016 03:00 pm

Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.   Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program.  Defendant to report within the first business day after posting bail or released from custody.
